title: How do TV shows find unpopular, but amazing music? - Quora

response.answer_text: Most TV shows have a Music Coordinator or Music Supervisor who selects music “cues” to use in each episode. If the project has a a decent budget, the show has a Composer who writes specific pieces of music for each episode. This requires recording this original music so it’s a much more expensive situation. As a show runs this original music is compiled into a “Library” for later use. This lowers the cost per episode. I believe the music you’re asking about is music composed for each show so it’s truly new and previously unheard. Some shows use a variety of the above to save time and expense. Watch the end credits for evidence of this. Also don’t for get that an original score, written for the show usually has a theme that you’ll hear in many different emotional variations from dramatic to comedic, to suspense… A good composer’s artistry can cover a variety of problems and failures in a show’s production.
